intro: Lychnis fulgens var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth fireweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glabrous, as indicated by its variety name. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
